page.title: 18Traffic Problems
page.content: The roads in Culmstock are becoming more crowded and dangerous every day. In 1968 when I first came to the village,there was a twice daily bus service to Tiverton, Cullompton and Wellington together with school coaches bringing the Primary children to the village and taking the older children to Uffculme and Tiverton. The regular bus services have gone and a coach company runs a private service thrice weekly to Taunton via Wellington and additionally twice to Wellington and once to Exeter. School coaches to the village and Uffculme remain. The biggest change has been the designation of the principal road through the village as a lorry route.
